intro: Brodiaea nana, commonly known as the dwarf brodiaea, is a small, flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and delicate, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of white or pale purple blooms in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Brodiaea nana is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to naturalize in suitable conditions.
